name: Vampirism
description: A humanoid slain by a vampire's bite and then buried in the ground rises the following night as a vampire spawn under the vampire's control. A character reduced to 0 Hit Points by a vampire's bite attack has their Hit Point maximum reduced, and if this kills them, they may rise as a vampire spawn.

transmission.method: A humanoid slain by a vampire's Bite attack and then buried rises as a vampire spawn. Alternatively, a vampire can choose to transform a slain humanoid by letting it drink the vampire's blood.
transmission.hitPointReduction: The vampire's Bite reduces the target's Hit Point maximum by the amount of Necrotic damage dealt. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a Long Rest.
transmission.deathCondition: If the Bite reduces the target's Hit Point maximum to 0, the target dies. A humanoid slain this way and then buried rises as a vampire spawn the following night.

vampireSpawnTraits.description: A vampire spawn is under the control of the vampire that created it. It has many of the vampire's traits but is weaker.
changes: Gains Resistance to Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing from nonmagical attacks
Gains Spider Climb (can climb difficult surfaces, including ceilings)
Gains Regeneration (10 HP at start of turn if not in sunlight or running water)
Gains Bite attack (melee, Piercing + Necrotic damage, regains HP)
Sunlight Hypersensitivity (takes 20 Radiant damage when starting turn in sunlight)
Cannot enter a residence without invitation
Harmed by running water (takes 20 Acid damage when ending turn in running water)
Stake to the Heart (Paralyzed if pierced through the heart with a wooden stake while Incapacitated)

fullVampireTransformation.description: A vampire can choose to turn a slain humanoid into a full vampire instead of a spawn. The vampire allows the dying humanoid to drink its blood. The humanoid then rises as a vampire with its own will, though it may owe fealty to the creating vampire.
requirements: The humanoid must be slain by the vampire's Bite
The vampire must feed its blood to the dying humanoid
The humanoid must be buried and rise the following night

otherMethods: Killing the vampire that created the spawn may free it (DM discretion)
A Wish spell can end the curse of vampirism
curing.notes: Vampirism is extremely difficult to cure. Remove Curse does not work against vampirism. The transformation into undead fundamentally changes the creature, and only the most powerful magic can reverse it. A vampire spawn freed from its master's control becomes a full vampire over time.
